item.title: Nand2tetris W6
item.author: hieuletrung102@gmail.com (Hieu Le)
item.description: This week marks the end of building hardware parts and the beginning of the computer software hierarchy. Each computer has a binary machine language, including a number of 0’s and 1’s, and a symbolic machine language, consisting of human-friendly mnemonics. Both languages serve the same purpose and are completely equivalent. However, assembly language is far easier for human to write and understand. To enjoy this benefit, it is required for a assembler to translate the symbols and labels into binary machine code.
